column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////We were seated and the server was incredibly cheerful and friendly. She appeared to have a couple of large parties in addition to us so although the service wasn't lightning fast
column2: it was definitely fast enough given how busy she was. She took our drink orders
column3: it took some time to get our beer because they were changing the kegs
column4: which was poor timing but had nothing to do with the service of the restaurant. However
column5: the food took a very long time to come out
column6: which was odd to me seeing they took our order about 40 minutes before we were even seated to *avoid* the food taking too long. And when it came out
column7: it was lukewarm. For a pizza that doughy
column8: we both agreed it lacked flavor. I wouldn't say it was worth the wait.
